definition: time flies (idiom)
variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
moon/month/monthly/CL:個|个[ge4],輪|轮[lun2]
as/as if/such as
shuttle (textiles)/to move back and fro

sentences.english: Time passes like flowing water, years if shuttle.
Many people say time speeds up as we age.
sentences.chinese: 许多人说，时间如逝岁月如梭，把我们给催老了。

sentences.english: As time goes by, soon 2010 will be history.
sentences.chinese: 岁月如梭，转眼2010年即将成为过去。

sentences.english: Years Rusuo, time flies, six primary school life, a brief span.
sentences.chinese: 岁月如梭，光阴似箭，六年小学生活，弹指一挥间。

definition: time flies like an arrow (idiom); How time flies!
the sun and moon like a shuttle (idiom); How time flies!
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
the passage of the years/the flow of time
in a flash (idiom)
(literary) (of time) to slip away
(of time) to pass quickly/to be fleeting
to pass in an instant/over in the twinkling of an eye
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
time available
years/time
in a flash/in the blink of an eye/to glance
time/era/period of time
as time goes by (idiom)
lit. one's youth will never return/to make the most of one's opportunities (idiom)
things have remained the same, but people have changed
